_header: O Heavenly Star most comfortable of light
Subjects: plague; prayers, to Virgin Mary; Virgin Mary, prayers to
_description: ‘De sancta Maria contra pestilenciam’ — eleven stanzas rhyme royal

Chetham6709.First Lines:
O hevynly sterre most Comfortable of lyghtWhich with thy goostely
                    gracyous InfluenceHaste Claryfyed and put vnto flyghtAll mysty wedrys
                    perlyous for pestylence…
Chetham6709.Last Lines:
…Whan we shall passe mawgre the serpentOff grace & Mercy
                    be with vs presentAmen
Chetham6709.Attributed Author:
Explicit Secundum lydgate / God grawnte vs grace quod /
                                Willelmus Cotson Canonicus (f.
                    287v)
Chetham6709.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 206.
